head.supplied: 4/4/96 ¶ ¶ In a clear writing herewith, ¶ dear Mr Macdonald, I give my views on the two propositions. Please keep it, though the remarks are ¶ only intended for you ¶ at present You may regard the...

div.p: A38, Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (Victorian Branch), Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

In a clear writing herewith,
Enclosure not found. dear Mr Macdonald, I give my views on the two propositions. Please keep it, though the remarks are only intended for you at present You may regard the realisation of Mr W.'s
A. J. Wright, a member of the Council of the Victorian Branch of the Royal Geographical Society of Australasia? At a meeting of the Council on 1 April 1896, under the heading 'Proposed Annual Excursion', 'Correspondence was read from Mr. W. T. Manifold of Camperdown, and Mr. Joseph Archibald of Warrnambool, as to arrangements for an excursion to both localities named, and it was resolved to postpone further consideration of the matter' (Transactions of the Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (Victoria), vol. 14 (1896), p. 13). proposals not so easy, after you have read these notes of mine. We can have a Council meeting, when you have got an answer from Brisbane. Do you think that from the many, who intended so kindly to come to any meeting at Warnambool,
Warrnambool, Vic. Similar concerns about the utility of visiting Warrnambool in the hope of attracting members had been expressed In M to A. Macdonald, 10 March 1896.
many would jo[in] even as ordinary members I think not.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: If each member of Council went solely to adress one town, we might get good results at small [expense.]
